what-is.title: What is Sonolus?
what-is.body:
Unlike a traditional rhythm game, **Sonolus is more like a rhythm game framework**.
Anyone can create their own unique rhythm game modes in Sonolus, or host their own servers for other people to join and enjoy!

install-ios.title: Install Sonolus on iOS
install-ios.body:
**Sideload**: <https://wiki.sonolus.com/getting-started/installing/ios.html#sideload-with-pc>
Sideload with PC is the most reliable method. Currently there is no free sideload without PC option.
You **DO NOT** need to jailbreak to sideload.

install-android.title: Install Sonolus on Android
install-android.body:
**Sideload**: <https://wiki.sonolus.com/getting-started/installing/android.html#sideload>
If you are having trouble installing, try Google “`your device name` sideload” and follow guides.

servers.title: How do I play songs? Where can I find servers?
servers.body:
**Simply add whichever server you want to play, you can find a list of them here:** <#710550213231640627>
To add a server, tap on the __Server link__ `(https://...)` > Tap the __Open in Sonolus__ button under the Server Name > The server opens in Sonolus > Tap the __Save__ button.

You can add as many servers as you'd like.

note-speed.title: How do I change note speed?
note-speed.body: Before you start playing a level, click __Configuration__ > __Options__ > __Note Speed__.

offset-basic.title: My game is off beat/out of sync!
offset-basic.body:
You need to adjust your __Device Audio Offset__ (keep other offsets at 0)
Offset is different for every device, for most devices 0 offset is correct.

To properly adjust offset, turn on __Autoplay__, pay attention to see if audio and visual line up, and adjust accordingly.

offset-advanced.title: What does each offset do exactly?
offset-advanced.body:
__Device Audio Offset__: audio offset of your device. Use this to sync up audio and visual.
__Level Audio Offset__: extra audio offset for this level, should only be used when the level is poorly sync'd.
__Server Audio Offset__: extra audio offset for all levels in a server, should only be used when the entire server is poorly sync'd.
__Device Input Offset__: input offset of your device. Use this to sync up input.
__Engine Input Offset__: extra input offset for all levels using this engine, should only be used when you have trouble with the engine.

all-miss.title: I'm getting all Miss!
all-miss.body: Check both your __Device Input Offset__ and __Engine Input Offset__. If you don't know what they are for, simply set them to 0.

change-item.title: How do I change skin/background/SFX/particle effect?
change-item.body:
Before you start playing a level, click __Configuration__ and change them in there.
You can also select a skin from a different server, for example using Project Sekai skin for Bandori levels.

chart.title: How do I make my own charts?
chart.body:
**Bestdori**
<https://bestdori.com/community/charts>

**SweetPotato & ChartCyanvas**
MikuMikuWorld: <https://github.com/crash5band/MikuMikuWorld>
PaletteWorks: <https://wiki.purplepalette.net/create-charts/editor/paletteworks>
Ched: <https://wiki.purplepalette.net/create-charts/editor/ched>

~~**Upload your chart to SweetPotato here: **
<https://potato.purplepalette.net/>~~
SweetPotato is currently full with no known plans of a server storage upgrade.

**Upload your chart to Chart Cyanvas here:**
<https://cc.sevenc7c.com/>

studio.title: How do I make my own skins/background/SFX?

judgment-color.title: How do I make Perfect/Great/Good/Miss have different colors?

judgment-error-color.title: How do I make early/late have different colors?

combo-color.title: How do I make All Perfect/Full Combo/Pass/Fail have different colors?

ui.title: Pause button is too small/how do I customize game UI?
ui.body: Before you start playing a level, click __Configuration__ > __UI__. You can adjust the type, size, transparency, animation.

genre.title: Where can I find this genre of songs?
genre.body: We don't know, but check out some servers in <#710550213231640627> and maybe you will find what you like!

magic.title: The game looked different on the YouTube videos i saw, how do I make it look like that?
magic.body: You've been duped by movie magic. Either they're using private asset servers or they're editing it in post.

sweet-potato-homepage.title: Project Sekai Fanmade server (SweetPotato) link doesn't work?
sweet-potato-homepage.body: Their server currently does not have a homepage, however it is perfectly playable. Simply add it into your Sonolus app and you can play.

sekai-viewer-slow.title: New songs in Project Sekai official chart server are not working.
sekai-viewer-slow.body: For newly added songs, it takes some time for Sekai Viewer to process them. Please wait for a bit and they will be ready.

testflight-update.title: I can't update Sonolus on TestFlight.
testflight-update.body: Make sure you are currently using the same Apple ID as the one when you first installed Sonolus.

update-keep-collection.title: If I update Sonolus, will I lose my collections?
update-keep-collection.body: No, as long as you don't uninstall but simply install on top of it, everything should be all safe.

sideload-expire.title: I sideloaded Sonolus on iOS, it stopped working today.
sideload-expire.body: A signature lasts only 7 days, once expired you need to sign the `.ipa` file again and sideload it. Some sideloading tools (AltStore for example) will do this for you automatically.

free-up-space.title: Sonolus is taking up too much space, what do I do?
free-up-space.body: __Settings__ > __Repository__ > __Manage__ > __Delete__, it should free up lots of space (your collections are safe)

black-screen.title: My Sonolus is completely black.
black-screen.body: Before you start playing a level, click __Configuration__ > __Options__ > __Horizontal/Vertical Stage Cover__ and make sure it's at 0%.

find.title: I want to find this level I saw in a YouTube video, how?
find.body: Go to that server, and search any text you can see in the video: song name, artists name, author name, `#ID`, description.
